runs.comm: Doug Bollinger's first ball in an international Twenty20 is sprayed down the leg side, and called wide

bounce and movement outside off! Bollinger floated this one right up to the batsman, but wide outside off. Smith through himself into the drive, but the ball seamed sharply away from him. Good take behind the wicket too
beaten outside off! Well, there's life in this early-season wicket after all. Again, this hit the seam and left Smith
on a length and straight, Smith stays deep in the crease to defend. There's a cheer from the crowd as he lays bat on ball.
Smith is looking just a little flustered out there after a fantastic bouncer from Bollinger. Smith appeared to lose sight of it, ducking very late as he turned away from the rearing delivery

stifled appeal! Bollinger pushed this one right up to Smith, whose feet went absolutely nowhere. The ball thudded into the pads off a thick inside edge, which was quickly spotted by the umpire as the appeal went up
hurled down the leg side, another wide. A bit of a mixed bag, this over from Bollinger. Some magical deliveries, some utter filth
bowled him! A flat-footed Smith pokes outside off, the ball nips in off the seam and takes the inside edge, clattering into the stumps. First blood to Australia
drifts into Amla's hip and he flicks it away through midwicket to open his account as captain
that flew! Short of a length and it climbs off the surface to beat Amla's attempt at an upper cut
angled into the right hander and it's flicked off the hip but straight to short fine-leg
fuller this time on off stump, Amla meets it with a well-timed drive but picks out mid-off
hint of width this time but Amla can't really time his back-foot drive and it rolls between cover and mid-off
good length on middle stump, Ingram comes forward and a think inside edge finds a large space on the leg side
back of a length, nips back into Ingram and an inside edge comes off the pad square on the off side
that's typical of Amla, jumps onto the back foot then aims to whip the ball into the leg side although this time he couldn't find the gap as mid-on does the fielding
just backs a little to leg to give himself some room but can't beat backward point as he opens the face
short ball from Bollinger...this one loops off the surface and beats Ingram's attempt at a pull. Was fairly close to a wide, but he gets away with it
tight line on off stump and it's pushed to backward point...good pressure here from Bollinger

gone! Brilliant work from David Warner in the deep and his bullet-arm has beaten Amla. Ingram pulled the ball, off a good length, over midwicket but it didn't have the legs to reach the rope and coming back for a third Amla was a little off the pace. The throw was a little away from the stumps, but Wade had time to get it back
on the hip and flicked to fine leg
down the leg side but it feathers the pad through to the keeper so Cummins escapes a wide
excellent bouncer, good line over middle and off and Duminy - who has a history against the short ball - sways his head out of the way
on leg stump, Duminy goes to flick it away and gets a leading edge but it lands away from the fielders
first full half-volley from an Australia bowler and it's put away with a strong square drive...much-needed for South Africa
more good timing, this time through the leg side as he flicks it off middle and leg. Unlike in the previous over it has the pace to cross the boundary
starts very full and quite wide, jabbed into the off side
swing from Watson and it clips the pad, rather than bat, and Wade can't quite get across with a dive
into the fifth over but Duminy decides to shoulder arms outside off
driven up to mid-off and they just need to scurry a touch to make the single
another boundary, and again driven square through the off side as Inrgam frees his arms to bisect cover and backward point
full and wide from Watson, almost another boundary but this time he picks out cover who makes a diving save
things are starting to flow a little now, this time it's a cover drive from Duminy that races through the off-side field
he follows that with another one but this time isn't timed quite so well
driven into the off side
he's getting plenty of chances to play his drive, but this one is nearly spooned to cover as it stops a fraction in the surface
backward point in action as he fields a square drive...Pattinson pitching full which encourages the drive
driven firmly to mid-off who is fairly deep but can stop the single
round the wicket and tucked into the leg side
tossed up by Hussey and it's greeted by an expansive drive down the ground
plays a paddle sweep but it doesn't really come off and lobs away for a single towards short fine-leg
worked out to deep midwicket
nice inside-out drive through cover
cramps Duminy for room on the back foot and he can't get it away. Tight start from Hussey, who will race through his overs
hint of width but Ingram can't put it away as he plays and misses with a flamboyant drive
dropped into the off side and there's a good understand to get the single
short ball that he ducked under...touched 90mph according to the speed fun
he breaks the shackles with a pick-up over midwicket and it was well clear of the fielders. Was a decent ball, just T20 batting
good follow-up, a slower ball that devices Duminy into playing too early and missing his dab
another good one that scoots past the edge. South Africa not able to kick-on.
chopped away through the off side and the cover sweeper dives near the boundary
palmed for six! Even Warner couldn't catch this. Lofted down the ground and it kept long-on interested. Warner leapt, timed it well, got a hand on the ball but helped it over the boundary
worked away to the leg side
uses his feet down the ground again
along the ground through midwicket and Warner in the action again as he races onto it to prevent a second
opens the face to backward point
dabbed away down to third man
dragged down short but Duminy can't take advantage as he fails to time his pull
opens the face and sends this down to third man
round the wicket, full on off stump, driven square into the off side and a direct hit from point would have found the non-striker short but Steve Smith's aim isn't quite good enough
beats the outside edge as Ingram plays on the walk
hint of desperation as Ingram tries to slog a full ball over the leg side but doesn't make contact
that's a decent blow...O'Keefe's first ball disappears into the stand over midwicket and Duminy did really well because he was almost beaten in the flight
cut out to deep cover
pushed back to the bowler
fetched from outside off and swept out to deep midwicket
touch shorter and takes Duminy on the pads
the batsman makes contact this time and finds deep backward square
dug in a little short by Pattinson. Duminy rocked back and set himself for an uppercut but the ball zoomed past his top edge. Good bounce in this wicket for the quicks
landing on a length this time, and Duminy knocks it back to the bowler, who threatens to throw down the stumps
punched to deep mid-off with a high left elbow. They ran the single with great urgency, but there simply wasn't time for a second run
Pattinson switches to round the wicket for the nuggety Ingram, and succeeds in cramping him for room

the partnership is broken! Pattinson floated up a slower cutter outside off and Ingram scythed the drive over cover ... but couldn't get it over Cummins out on the boundary. That'll annoy the South Africans, these two were just starting to build some real momentum
cracked through cover on the up, just the single to be had
forced through cover point off the back foot to get Miller on strike
dug in at a feisty pace, Miller whipping the ball away from his ribs as he swivels on his back foot
nicely played by Duminy, waiting on a length delivery and angling it deftly down to third man
just short of a good length, outside off, and he's cut away through backward point
well played! Bollinger fired in a sharp yorker but Miller jabbed his bat down in time, and picked up a single as the ball rolled into the leg side
a fortuitous edge! Duminy was aiming to run the ball down to third man once again but ended up playing it much finer than he had hoped. Still, he'll take the boundary any way he can get it
nudged off the hip through square leg, just the single
slower ball, and it's really slow! Duminy spotted it in good time, squeezing the ball through point
fired in full and fast at the toes, Miller digs it out back to the bowler
a touch wild from Cummins, who sprays down a high full toss outside off. He's not punished for it, however, Miller slapping the ball to point
Miller backs away to make some room, carving the ball out to wide long off
dug in short ... Too short, in fact, and he's called wide. That ballooned high over the ducking Duminy's head
another slow off cutter, aimed at the pads, and Duminy picks up a single with a nudge to backward square
he arrows one at the pads first ball, and is tucked to square leg
Duminy dances down and heaves. Fortunately for him he managed to get an inside edge on the shot
hoicked out to deep midwicket, on the sweep.
chipped in the air into the leg side, but falling well short of the fielder at long on
swung away to fine leg! Hussey fired in another quicker one but it was misdirected down the leg side and Duminy sent it racing to the boundary with a paddle-pull
again Duminy uses his feet, flicking the ball to midwicket
squeezed out through point, and Duminy hurries back for the second. Good, hard running

Bollinger finds the toe end of the bat with a full delivery, the ball ricocheting into Duminy's pads and going nowhere. Still, they take the chance to hustle a quick single, Bollinger running across and hoofing the ball just past the stumps
fired down the leg side. It kisses the thigh pad on the way through, however, and so not called wide
clobbered! There was a touch of Graeme Smith in this shot from Miller. He walked at the bowler and just clubbed it through extra cover. Plenty of muscle in the shot
nice comeback from Bollinger, who sends down a slower delivery on a length outside off to beat Miller's outside edge
hacked to midwicket, just the single
swiped down to long on, just the single

a resounding crack off the bat as Duminy murders a pull to midwicket! This shot echoed round Newlands. Watson dropped it short without the pace to back up the length and Duminy absolutely hammered it away
Watson's back over the wicket now, and Duminy picks up a single with a jab to cover
drilled down to long off. Both batsmen are hitting the ball really hard
clipped down the ground, and that's the half-century for Duminy. He's done really well to guide the innings after a wobbly start
off the bottom edge, and down to the third man boundary! The ball was fired in on a yorker length outside off, Miller swung hard and Wade had no chance of stopping it
swung away to deep midwicket! That's just the start Duminy will have been hoping for in this over. Good shot too, a pick-up off a length delivery
boom! Pattinson's length is really off here. Another back of a length delivery and Duminy's eyes just lit up, he stepped back and creamed it into the crowd beyond the deep midwicket boundary
a low, dipping full toss now from Pattinson, and it's driven out to deep cover
oh dear. Pattinson spears one down metres outside off, a definite wide. He's losing his composure a little
a cutter, on a length and a little straighter than the last delivery. Chopped to extra cover
another slower ball from Pattinson. Duminy didn't quite pick it, was too early into the shot, and ended up tapping it back to the bowler
six more! What fantastic timing on the shot. Pattinson floated down another low full toss and Duminy slapped the drive up and over deep extra cover. This one went even further than the last!
good slower ball from Cummins. Miller had set himself for a massive mow but had to adjust at the last moment, pushing the ball back to the bowler
the yorker this time, and it's squeezed out to backward point

Cummins strikes with the slower delivery! It was another looping offcutter, which Duminy actualy seemed to have picked as he bent into a slog sweep. He sliced under the ball however, to send it rocketing up into the night sky and back down into Watson's lap at cover
two wickets in two balls! Both set batsmen have been dismissed attempting big shots. Cummins pitched this one up and a shot was on, but Miller could only loft it to Warner's hands at long off

that hat-trick ball is a swinging full toss aimed at middle, and it's flicked out to deep square by an emotionless Botha. Ah, and Marsh, on as a sub, slides right past it out on the boundary, allowing the four and drawing a barracking from the crowd
a bouncer from Cummins, but it's misdirected and called wide

three wickets in the over! Again it's the slower ball that does the trick. Botha came charging down the track and didn't know quite what to do with the delivery once it got to him. He was aiming to leg, but the leading edge lobbed weakly to cover

a spliced pull falls safely at deep midwicket! Heino Kuhn appeared to be startled by the short delivery, he was in no position to play the shot. It's hard to believe Watto's bowling could startle anyone, but there you go
chipped down the ground ... and some great, committed fielding from Steve Smith saves the boundary. He charged after the ball, slid and tapped it back into the field. Classy stuff
Watson sends down a yorker outside off, and the ball slips under Peterson's flailing bat

shot! Peterseon walks across his stumps - having noticed that fine leg had been brought up - and scoops a low full toss down to the boundary. And with that, fine leg is promptly sent back out again! Third man is up

clatter! Peterson had an almighty heave across the line at a straight one, and his leg stump was knocked out of the ground. Not much in the way of a celebration from Watto, but that wicket will almost certainly keep South Africa to less than 150
a full toss strikes Theron on the pad as he backs to leg, and they hustle a leg bye to end the innings
